title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement parmartsam@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Get latest data
text: Get latest data (newer version available)
code: latest <- latest_data() #> [1] "No update available. Returning existing package dataset." tail(latest, 4) #> # A tibble: 4 × 17 #>      id name     date       manne…¹ armed   age gender race  city  state signs…² #>   <dbl> <chr>    <date>     <chr>   <chr> <dbl> <chr>  <chr> <chr> <chr> <lgl>   #> 1  8411 NA       2022-09-11 shot    tire…    NA M      NA    Hous… TX    FALSE   #> 2  8414 NA       2022-09-11 shot    gun      NA M      NA    Los … CA    FALSE   #> 3  8420 Igor La… 2022-09-11 shot    gun      53 M      NA    Wall… MI    FALSE   #> 4  8413 Cody Ki… 2022-09-12 shot    gun      31 M      NA    St. … FL    FALSE   #> # … with 6 more variables: threat_level <chr>, flee <chr>, body_camera <lgl>, #> #   longitude <dbl>, latitude <dbl>, is_geocoding_exact <lgl>, and abbreviated #> #   variable names ¹​manner_of_death, ²​signs_of_mental_illness

title: Washington Post Police Shooting Dataset
text: Use R access Washington Post Police Shootings dataset. Provides convenient functions spend less time data wrangling time generating findings.

title: Washington Post Police Shooting Dataset
text: can install development version wapoposh GitHub :

title: Washington Post Police Shooting Dataset
text: basic example shows interact dataset: can use latest_data() get latest dataset Washington Post Github repo.
code: library(wapoposh) library(dplyr) # basic example code tail(policeshootings, 4) #> # A tibble: 4 × 17 #>      id name     date       manne…¹ armed   age gender race  city  state signs…² #>   <dbl> <chr>    <date>     <chr>   <chr> <dbl> <chr>  <chr> <chr> <chr> <lgl>   #> 1  8411 <NA>     2022-09-11 shot    tire…    NA M      <NA>  Hous… TX    FALSE   #> 2  8414 <NA>     2022-09-11 shot    gun      NA M      <NA>  Los … CA    FALSE   #> 3  8420 Igor La… 2022-09-11 shot    gun      53 M      <NA>  Wall… MI    FALSE   #> 4  8413 Cody Ki… 2022-09-12 shot    gun      31 M      <NA>  St. … FL    FALSE   #> # … with 6 more variables: threat_level <chr>, flee <chr>, body_camera <lgl>, #> #   longitude <dbl>, latitude <dbl>, is_geocoding_exact <lgl>, and abbreviated #> #   variable names ¹​manner_of_death, ²​signs_of_mental_illness glimpse(policeshootings) #> Rows: 7,743 #> Columns: 17 #> $ id                      <dbl> 3, 4, 5, 8, 9, 11, 13, 15, 16, 17, 19, 21, 22,… #> $ name                    <chr> "Tim Elliot", "Lewis Lee Lembke", "John Paul Q… #> $ date                    <date> 2015-01-02, 2015-01-02, 2015-01-03, 2015-01-0… #> $ manner_of_death         <chr> "shot", "shot", "shot and tasered", "shot", "s… #> $ armed                   <chr> "gun", "gun", "unarmed", "toy weapon", "nail g… #> $ age                     <dbl> 53, 47, 23, 32, 39, 18, 22, 35, 34, 47, 25, 31… #> $ gender                  <chr> "M", "M", "M", "M", "M", "M", "M", "M", "F", "… #> $ race                    <chr> "A", "W", "H", "W", "H", "W", "H", "W", "W", "… #> $ city                    <chr> "Shelton", "Aloha", "Wichita", "San Francisco"… #> $ state                   <chr> "WA", "OR", "KS", "CA", "CO", "OK", "AZ", "KS"… #> $ signs_of_mental_illness <lgl> TRUE, FALSE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE,… #> $ threat_level            <chr> "attack", "attack", "other", "attack", "attack… #> $ flee                    <chr> "Not fleeing", "Not fleeing", "Not fleeing", "… #> $ body_camera             <lgl> FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALS… #> $ longitude               <dbl> -123.122, -122.892, -97.281, -122.422, -104.69… #> $ latitude                <dbl> 47.247, 45.487, 37.695, 37.763, 40.384, 35.877… #> $ is_geocoding_exact      <lgl> TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE… # get latest data latest <- latest_data() #> [1] "No update available. Returning existing package dataset." tail(latest, 4) #> # A tibble: 4 × 17 #>      id name     date       manne…¹ armed   age gender race  city  state signs…² #>   <dbl> <chr>    <date>     <chr>   <chr> <dbl> <chr>  <chr> <chr> <chr> <lgl>   #> 1  8411 <NA>     2022-09-11 shot    tire…    NA M      <NA>  Hous… TX    FALSE   #> 2  8414 <NA>     2022-09-11 shot    gun      NA M      <NA>  Los … CA    FALSE   #> 3  8420 Igor La… 2022-09-11 shot    gun      53 M      <NA>  Wall… MI    FALSE   #> 4  8413 Cody Ki… 2022-09-12 shot    gun      31 M      <NA>  St. … FL    FALSE   #> # … with 6 more variables: threat_level <chr>, flee <chr>, body_camera <lgl>, #> #   longitude <dbl>, latitude <dbl>, is_geocoding_exact <lgl>, and abbreviated #> #   variable names ¹​manner_of_death, ²​signs_of_mental_illness

title: Washington Post Police Shooting Dataset
text: Note repo scheduled update package data weekly basis. However, require reinstall pull latest processed data (.rda) file. alternative, latest_data() function pull current public dataset Washington Post.

title: Washington Post Police Shooting Dataset
text: Credit goes Washington Post research reporting/database development team compiling sharing dataset Github repo. Hex icon created using hexmake app ColinFay. Police icons created surang - Flaticon

title: Washington Post Police Shooting Dataset
text: dataset originally still published Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International (CC -NC-SA 4.0) license. dataset package slightly cleaned provided R data file format.

title: Washington Post Police Shooting Dataset
text: Please note wapoposh project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Get latest data from Washington Post Github Repo — latest_data
code: latest_data() #> [1] "No update available. Returning existing package dataset." #> # A tibble: 7,743 × 17 #>       id name    date       manne…¹ armed   age gender race  city  state signs…² #>    <dbl> <chr>   <date>     <chr>   <chr> <dbl> <chr>  <chr> <chr> <chr> <lgl>   #>  1     3 Tim El… 2015-01-02 shot    gun      53 M      A     Shel… WA    TRUE    #>  2     4 Lewis … 2015-01-02 shot    gun      47 M      W     Aloha OR    FALSE   #>  3     5 John P… 2015-01-03 shot a… unar…    23 M      H     Wich… KS    FALSE   #>  4     8 Matthe… 2015-01-04 shot    toy …    32 M      W     San … CA    TRUE    #>  5     9 Michae… 2015-01-04 shot    nail…    39 M      H     Evans CO    FALSE   #>  6    11 Kennet… 2015-01-04 shot    gun      18 M      W     Guth… OK    FALSE   #>  7    13 Kennet… 2015-01-05 shot    gun      22 M      H     Chan… AZ    FALSE   #>  8    15 Brock … 2015-01-06 shot    gun      35 M      W     Assa… KS    FALSE   #>  9    16 Autumn… 2015-01-06 shot    unar…    34 F      W     Burl… IA    FALSE   #> 10    17 Leslie… 2015-01-06 shot    toy …    47 M      B     Knox… PA    FALSE   #> # … with 7,733 more rows, 6 more variables: threat_level <chr>, flee <chr>, #> #   body_camera <lgl>, longitude <dbl>, latitude <dbl>, #> #   is_geocoding_exact <lgl>, and abbreviated variable names ¹​manner_of_death, #> #   ²​signs_of_mental_illness

what: Washington Post Police Shooting Raw Dataset — policeshootings
title: Washington Post Police Shooting Raw Dataset — policeshootings
text: Washington Post compiling database every fatal shooting United States police officer line duty since 2015.

title: Washington Post Police Shooting Raw Dataset — policeshootings
Washington Post Police Shooting Raw Dataset — policeshootings
text: data frame 17 variables: id double unique identifier victim name character name victim date double date fatal shooting YYYY-MM-DD format manner_of_death character manner death armed character indicates victim armed sort implement police officer believed inflict harm age double age victim gender character gender victim. Post identifies victims gender identify reports indicate differs biological sex. race character race victim city character municipality fatal shooting took place. Note cases field may contain county name specific municipality unavailable unknown. state character two-letter postal code abbreviation signs_of_mental_illness logical News reports indicated victim history mental health issues, expressed suicidal intentions experiencing mental distress time shooting. threat_level character threat_level column used flag incidents story Amy Brittain October 2015. http://www.washingtonpost.com/sf/investigative/2015/10/24/-duty--fire/ described story, general criteria attack label direct immediate threat life. include incidents officers others shot , threatened gun, attacked weapons physical force, etc. attack category meant flag highest level threat. undetermined categories represent remaining cases. includes many incidents officers others faced significant threats. flee character News reports indicated victim moving away officers body_camera logical News reports indicated officer wearing body camera may recorded portion incident. longitude double longitue location shooting expressed WGS84 coordinates, geocoded addresses. coordinates rounded 3 decimal places, meaning precision 80-100 meters within contiguous U.S. latitude double latitue location shooting expressed WGS84 coordinates, geocoded addresses. coordinates rounded 3 decimal places, meaning precision 80-100 meters within contiguous U.S. is_geocoding_exact logical reflects accuracy coordinates. true means coordinates location shooting (within approximately 100 meters), false means coordinates centroid larger region, city county shooting happened

title: Washington Post Police Shooting Raw Dataset — policeshootings
text: https://github.com/washingtonpost/data-police-shootings/

what: wapoposh: Washington Post Police Shooting Dataset — wapoposh-package
title: wapoposh: Washington Post Police Shooting Dataset — wapoposh-package
text: Provides Washington Post Police Shootings dataset. Data source: Washington Post Github https://github.com/washingtonpost/data-police-shootings.
